titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for Ypsilanti (Mich. : Township) records, 1827-1923
titlestmt.author: Collection processed and finding aid created by Michigan Historical Collections staff

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created by Thomas E. Powers, October 2007

profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid prepared using Describing Archives: A Content Standard (DACS)

change.item: Original encoding from Word 2000 file using Word macros and Xmetal.

Ypsilanti (Mich. : Township) records, 1827-1923
titlepage.author:
Finding aid created by
Michigan Historical Collections staff

physdesc.extent: 12 volumes and ca. 30 items (in 1 box), 1 outsize folder, and 1 microfilm reel.

did.abstract: Township meeting minutes; highway commissioners, 1827-1831; assessment rolls, 1832-1838; also miscellaneous school records, districts 1 and 5; and election record books, 1827-1860.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The record came from multiple sources. In 1938, Edward D. Foster (donor no. 382) donated the bulk of the early records; in June 1942, Mrs. Leona Weaver (donor no. 1701) donated the records of school district no. 1; Wystan Stevens (donor no. 4452) donated miscellaneous other materials.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the records are not expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Ypsilanti (Mich. : Township) records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Ypsilanti Township is located in eastern Washtenaw County, Michigan.

scopecontent.p: Township in eastern Washtenaw County, Michiagn. The record group consists of a scattering of early nineteenth century Ypsilanti Township records, mainly in the period of 1827 to 1838. These include minutes of township meetings and of the highway commission, and assessment rolls. Another portion of the record group consists of records of individual school districts.

note.p: (1 reel of positive microfilm: CB Micro)
